title: if you cant handle ranked...
body:
and you feel you might rage quit..
Dont play ranked. You ruin the game for your team and you boost the enemy for free.

replies.body: Normals are more laid back anyway. If you are on tilt, why are you playing a game type with more stress?

exactly my thoughts. Ranked is super stressful, some people dont even car about other peoples life so they just troll. Its crappy but oh well.

Normals ends up being too...laidback.

I.e. people give too little fks about it. Baron dancing, AFking, int feeding, trolling.

I just treat ranked like normal draft at this point.

Yeah, I'm in gold V for ranked, but in normals, I get mixed with diamonds, plats, etc. Yeah it's great practice, but still a lot of a$$es

If you can't handle it's just a video game..





























































And are afraid you might tilt cuz of other people's skill levels. Don't play the game.
I think we would lose 90% of the ranked playerbase.

Even as a guy who never ragequit, i have something like 4  games in total (with all account together 500+ ranked this season) where i did ragequit.
I bet there is not a single person who did not ragequit at all. Sometimes the stupidity is so much to handle and then just be like "ok, fak it, im out, will work the lost LP back later. This is just a game overall".
Brrrrr.
edit: Yes, i know. everyone want to looks cool on forum with this "i never ragequited". if you check my post, i said i may did 4 times form over 500+ games, sometimes you just have to if you want to keep your sanity.

Depends on what you see as 'ragequit' or 'tilt'.

If you leave after you died twice as jungler because your laners are too stupid to help you against an invade after you spam ping, that's just pathetic. The game isn't lost. Your laners surely have a reason why they didn't/couldn't help (being pushed to their turrets, which is also the reason why enemy jungler decided to invade). So just get your shit together and learn to play from a position where you're behind.

On the other hand, if it's 22/3 and you just lost your third inhibitor while you didn't even take out a single turret of them and no dragons, the game is beyond lost and if you stop trying at this point, I wouldn't blame you.

In ranked, I never left a game or stopped trying (before someone else already afked and the game was obviously lost) even when I am 0/6 because I generally play lategame champions and I know that comebacks do happen. I've had games 10/30 where we suddenly just win every teamfight because the enemy team is too cocky.

You're welcome to look at my most recent game. I had a Maokai support that said i never followed up when he was doing flash twisted advances and chasing from lane all the way to blue buff for kill when we're getting kited to hell.

my mid lane never followed his mid or pinged MIA, my jax tower dove alone and had connection issues. Im sitting on a 5 loss with a win thrown in there streak from my last 6 games and literally almost every single one of them have been like this. the one won game was like the others but we picked up baron, aced, and shoved at 40 for a win.

Im in Silver 5 about to be demoted to bronze and i've now resorted to muting all of my team mates because their plays are so stupid my hands start shaking in frustration and i often quit the game for hours at a time to reset from stuff like this. I honestly dont know how people that arent smurfs reliably climb in this. i've gone from bronze 4 so silver 5 and my most recents games have had me literally tasting blood in anger from the half wits im squared with. from my words now you can see im still tilted and im about to go drink and play OFA to cool off.

I will vouch that this game makes people rage quit. and on occassion they're justified. I dont do it in ranked, but i promise you a spend long hours relaxing after many games before coming back. sometimes days.
That's what the OP says. If you start getting frustrated, don't play another ranked game until you think you can handle the bullshit that might happen.

I've never ragequit, the worst I've done is started building zz'rot on Diana. And then we had no hope of winning - I had 100% kill participation and was only 3 kills, 2 assists meanwhile the other team had around 20 kills and it was 4v5 and they had gotten our inhibs while we hadn't gotten any of their towers.
But I only started mid s5 so I'm still a new player

If you ragequit in the middle of a game because the game really was that bad, okay, I guess that's understandable given the circumstances. Entering a ranked game while knowing full well you're on tilt is what shouldn't be happening.

It sounds stupid but there are a lot of people who think "I can handle this" and go in.
I've tilted but never been toxic or rage quit.
bump

> if you cant handle ranked...

remember that those 5 people you face also don't handle ranked.

>and you boost the enemy for free. 

I make 5$ a game! ;p
You said that, as if people in ranked could get any more boosted.

I dont play ranked anymore. not because of the stress, but because of the players. for example, people like to give up over the smallest thing like bot is 0/2. that doesnt mean they cant comeback. Also everyone in ranked thinks its ok to flame for some reason.
Too many boosted animals since Dyna QUE was released.
Every {{champion:55}} main I run into in ranked.
what if I play my very best when I feel that I might rage quit though! should I play ranked then?

If you might ragequit, you're not playing your very best.

You might be doing well mechanically, but if you're in a mood that you might ragequit if things go wrong, you are unable to fight from a position when behind and  proper communication.
No way i want to express to all of these mid laners and adc's that they need to play better. It's the only way for people to actually try to improve. I hated being called bad so i slowly improved

90% of my matches are Normal, Normal dynamic, ARAM, Game mode rotations, Twisted Treeline all into one.

10% s(Quack)y, dramatic, serious business, ranked mode.

At least while in silver 2 i got two people into gold rank, I've stated many times to League friends and real friends that I have no interest in playing ranked anymore.

I dont enjoy ranked modes where you need a cooperating team at its top game. There is always going to be some problems in one game or more like connection issues, a random bug crash on certain hardware, a stranger or friend could be having a stressful time, trying to keep yourself focused and in a positive mood.

Dont get me started on the dynamic queue, glad im a support main but i freaking hate being only able to play that role only, its a gamble if someone will trade roles with you, if someone asks you to ban a champion that they don't like and you ban someone else they will seriously lose their S(quack) on you.

Mid asks me to ban Katarina. But I ban common strong picks like Yasuo, Brand, Shaco, ekko, i can sneak in Syndra because she is a strong mid laner that doesn't get alot of attention same as Ziggs.

They just lose their marbles and i don't need his/her drama,  f(ark) those people who get salty at me, i dont want to hear their whiny complaints i just want to win a ranked game.

Ranked is like applying for a job, you get the role you've applied or been forced to do and you have to deal with annoying a(bum cakes) that are your co-workers who just wont shut up or they take it so serious which they should on the 2nd part since it is ranked after all.

If the losing team goes tilt they will likely complain and you can just mute them but you still need them.

I hate some jerks i get in normals but i need them to answer my question if the enemy has ulted like a tryndamere or ekko.

I played a game last night where (surprise surprise) our Riven top rage quit when she was 1/4 with first blood.  Within 30 seconds of her leaving, our Sejuani left as well.  The kills were even too (we were ahead mid and bot), but that just made it a guaranteed loss.
I've never ragequit, so there are some of us out there. I've gotten close a couple of times, but never actually done it.
